article:
The '1979â80 Football League Cup' was the 20th season of the Football League
Cup, a knockout competition for England's top 92 football clubs. The winners
qualified for the 1980â81 UEFA Cup, if not already qualified for European
competition.

Wolverhampton Wanderers won the competition by defeating the reigning holders
and European champions Nottingham Forest 1â0 in the final on 15 March 1980. This
was their second League Cup success, after winning in 1974.
